section.title: VM Host Setup
section.para: The VM Host has four bridges involved in the setup.

Optional: When the VM Host is on a productive network with independent IP connectivity to the test networks, thus there no IP setup on any of these bridges including net1. But you can use the same network as the Host such as dhcp on net1
The net1 bridge contains an uplink port eth1 providing access to an external test/lan network for the vm7 router VM.

step.screen: $ cat /etc/sysconfig/network/ifcfg-net1` ``` STARTMODE='auto' BOOTPROTO='none' LINK_REQUIRED=no BRIDGE='yes' BRIDGE_STP='off' BRIDGE_FORWARDDELAY='0' BRIDGE_PORTS='eth1' ```

step.para: The net7, net8 and net8 are host-only bridges with dynamic VM ports (added by libvirt) only, specific and relevant for this setup. To view the cat /etc/sysconfig/network/ifcfg-net7 network settings, run:
step.screen: $ cat /etc/sysconfig/network/ifcfg-net7` ``` STARTMODE='auto' BOOTPROTO='none' LINK_REQUIRED=no LLADDR=66:00:00:00:00:07 BRIDGE='yes' BRIDGE_STP='off' BRIDGE_FORWARDDELAY='0' BRIDGE_PORTS='' ```

step.para: To view the ifcfg-net8 network settings, run the following command:
step.screen: $ cat /etc/sysconfig/network/ifcfg-net8 ``` STARTMODE='auto' BOOTPROTO='none' LINK_REQUIRED=no LLADDR=66:00:00:00:00:08 BRIDGE='yes' BRIDGE_STP='off' BRIDGE_FORWARDDELAY='0' BRIDGE_PORTS='' ```

step.para: To view the ifcfg-net9 network settings, run the following command:
step.screen: $ cat /etc/sysconfig/network/ifcfg-net9` ``` STARTMODE='auto' BOOTPROTO='none' LINK_REQUIRED=no LLADDR=66:00:00:00:00:09 BRIDGE='yes' BRIDGE_STP='off' BRIDGE_FORWARDDELAY='0' BRIDGE_PORTS='' ```
